/** * Provides a backup {@code Future} to replace an earlier failed {@code Future}. An implementation * of this interface can be applied to an input {@code Future} with {@link Futures#withFallback}. * * @param <V> the result type of the provided backup {@code Future} * * @author Bruno Diniz * @since 14.0 * @deprecated This interface's main user, {@link Futures#withFallback(ListenableFuture, * FutureFallback) Futures.withFallback}, has been updated to use {@link AsyncFunction}. We * recommend that other APIs be updated in the same way. This interface will be removed in Guava * release 20.0. */
unit.class:
@ Beta
@ Deprecated
@ GwtCompatible
public interface
FutureFallback <
V
>
{ /** * Returns a {@code Future} to be used in place of the {@code Future} that failed with the given * exception. The exception is provided so that the {@code Fallback} implementation can * conditionally determine whether to propagate the exception or to attempt to recover. * * @param t the exception that made the future fail. If the future's {@link Future#get() get} * method throws an {@link ExecutionException}, then the cause is passed to this method. Any * other thrown object is passed unaltered. */
ListenableFuture <
V
>
create (
Throwable
t
)
throws
Exception
;
}
